channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22360] MultiDelimitSerDe returns wrong results in last column when the loaded file has more columns than those in table schema
item.description:
Repro steps:

Input file:

1^,1^,^,0^,0^,0 
2^,1^,^,0^,1^,0 
3^,1^,^,0^,0^,0 
4^,1^,^,0^,1^,0

Queries:

CREATE TABLE  n2(colA int, colB tinyint, colC timestamp, colD smallint, colE smallint) ROW FORMAT SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.MultiDelimitSerDe' WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ("field.delim"="^,")STORED AS TEXTFILE;

LOAD DATA LOCAL INPATH '/Users/schaurasia/Documents/input_6_cols.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE n2;

 select * from n2;
// wrong last column results here.
+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+
| n2.cola  | n2.colb  | n2.colc  | n2.cold  | n2.cole  |
+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+
| 1        | 1        | NULL     | 0        | NULL     |
| 2        | 1        | NULL     | 0        | NULL     |
| 3        | 1        | NULL     | 0        | NULL     |
| 4        | 1        | NULL     | 0        | NULL     |
+----------+----------+----------+----------+----------+

Cause:
In multi-serde parsing, the total length calculation here: https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/rel/release-3.1.2/serde/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/serde2/lazy/LazyStruct.java#L308 does not take extra fields into account.
item.summary: MultiDelimitSerDe returns wrong results in last column when the loaded file has more columns than those in table schema

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: ShubhamChaurasia Please take a look at the work I did in HIVE-22337. I have addressed this there in a way that can apply to all text-based SerDe.

+1 overall

belugabehr

Shubham Chaurasia Please take a look at the work I did in HIVE-22337. I have addressed this there in a way that can apply to all text-based SerDe.

Thanks belugabehr, great work there! I see that the scenarios like this have been handled nicely at a common place there.
I see that org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.text.DelimitedTextSerde is capable of handling all kinds of delimiters.

But if someone still want to use MultiSerDe, we will need this patch.
ShubhamChaurasia My ask would be that we get HIVE-22337 resolved first and then build MultiSerDe on top of it.
ShubhamChaurasia Another thought would be to apply your changes to the 3.x branch of Hive.

+1 overall
